001package Ch05_Edges_Contours;
002
003import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
004import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.clipTo;
005
006import ij.ImagePlus;
007import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
008import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
009import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
010import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
011import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
012import imagingbook.common.edges.GrayscaleEdgeDetector;
013import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
014import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
015
016/**
017 * <p>
018 * ImageJ plugin, implementing a "cartoon" or "edge burn-in" effect by
019 * controlled darkening of image edges. Pixels are darkened depending on the
020 * value of the normalized edge magnitude (as produced by an edge operator). At
021 * points of maximum edge magnitude the darkening effect are strongest, while
022 * pixels remain unmodified where the edge magnitude is zero. See Ch. 5
023 * (Exercise 5.8) of [1] for additional details. Works for RGB color images
024 * only. The input image is modified.
025 * </p>
026 * <p>
027 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
028 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
029 * </p>
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 * @version 2022/11/17
033 *
034 */
035public class Cartoon_Effect implements PlugInFilter {
036        
037        private static double A = 0.05;
038        private static double B = 0.3;
039        private static boolean ShowOriginalEdgeMagnitude = false;
040        private static boolean ShowSoftenedEdgeMagnitude = false;
041        
042        /**
043         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image
044         * is currently open.
045         */
046        public Cartoon_Effect() {
047                if (noCurrentImage()) {
048                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.Clown);
049                }
050        }
051        
052        @Override
053        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
054                return DOES_RGB;        // TODO: make work for DOES_8G
055        }
056
057        @Override
058        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
059                if (!getUserInput()) {
060                        return;
061                }
062                
063                A = clipTo(A, 0.0, 1.0);
064                B = clipTo(B, 0.0, 1.0);
065                
066                int w = ip.getWidth();
067                int h = ip.getHeight();
068                
069                GrayscaleEdgeDetector ed = new GrayscaleEdgeDetector(ip);
070                FloatProcessor mag = ed.getEdgeMagnitude();
071                
072                if (ShowOriginalEdgeMagnitude) {
073                        ImageProcessor mag2 = mag.duplicate();
074                        mag2.invert();
075                        mag2.resetMinAndMax();
076                        new ImagePlus("E (inverted)", mag2).show();
077                }
078                
079                double magMax = mag.getMax();
080                
081                // soft-threshold edge magnitude
082                for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
083                        for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
084                                double s = mag.getf(u, v) / magMax;     // scale to 1.0
085                                mag.setf(u, v, (float) f(s, A, B));
086                        }
087                }
088                
089                if (ShowSoftenedEdgeMagnitude) {
090                        ImageProcessor mag3 = mag.duplicate();
091                        mag3.resetMinAndMax();
092                        new ImagePlus("f(E)", mag3).show();
093                }
094
095                // burn-in edges:
096                final int[] RGB = new int[3];
097                ColorProcessor cp = (ColorProcessor) ip;
098                for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
099                        for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
100                                cp.getPixel(u, v, RGB);
101                                float s = mag.getf(u, v);
102                                // darken pixel value by factor s
103                                RGB[0] = Math.round(RGB[0] * s);
104                                RGB[1] = Math.round(RGB[1] * s);
105                                RGB[2] = Math.round(RGB[2] * s);
106                                cp.putPixel(u, v, RGB);
107                        }
108                }       
109        }
110        
111        // soft-threshold function
112        private double f(double m, double a, double b) {
113                if (m < a) {
114                        return 1;
115                }
116                else if (m <= b) {
117                        return 0.5 * (1 + Math.cos(Math.PI * (m - a) / (b - a)));
118                }
119                else {
120                        return 0;
121                }
122        }
123        GenericDialog gd = null;
124        
125        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
126        
127        private boolean getUserInput() {        // TODO: add a preview button
128                gd = new GenericDialog(Cartoon_Effect.class.getSimpleName());
129                gd.addMessage("Parameters: 0 \u2264 a \u2264 b \u2264 1");
130                gd.addNumericField("a", A, 2);
131                gd.addNumericField("b", B, 2);
132                gd.addCheckbox("Show original edge magnitude", ShowOriginalEdgeMagnitude);
133                gd.addCheckbox("Show softened edge magnitude", ShowSoftenedEdgeMagnitude);
134                
135                gd.showDialog();
136                if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
137                        return false;
138                }
139                A = gd.getNextNumber();
140                B = gd.getNextNumber();
141                ShowOriginalEdgeMagnitude = gd.getNextBoolean();
142                ShowSoftenedEdgeMagnitude = gd.getNextBoolean();
143                return true;
144        }
145        
146}
